Reviews.Title: “wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: LoredanGasparini
Reviews.Content: I was at 22th floor and the view was really amazing. The grappa bar is really original.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Kerry M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for a conference. Arrived late evening and requested a high floor away from elevators. We were put on the 27th floor but right by the elevators but it was fine...no noise at all, which was our concern. The hotel is very clean and the personnel were friendly and accommodating. When I returned from my morning speed walk a staff member handed me a bottle of Evian as I came through the door. Very nice touch. The hotel is a five minute walk to Westfield Center and Union Square. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perhaps my car should get a bed, robe and slippers too”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Intercontinental. It was comfortable and clean, which is really all that matters, but there was nothing special about it. Judging from the room alone, it could have been Hilton or the Marriott. There was nothing I found particularly defining about it. I understand that the hotel is around 3 yrs old, and considering it was built next door to the convention center, I believe it was built for mostly business travelers in mind. The pool is just a lap pool with 2 lanes, so not that much room for a leisurely swim. The hot tub was nice but always filled with people. The ladies at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The concierges were also friendly and helpful in person. I did call down and ask for Thai food, and they suggest 2 places. When I looked them up on yelp, one of them had a very low rating from the city board of health!! A quick review of health ratings for the restaurants that they suggest, would make them better equipped to recommend decent, healthy restaurants. The real shocker at the hotel was parking. It is $65 per night!! I asked them if they were going to clean it, Perhaps it should get a bed, a robe and slippers too. Valet understood the shock on my face and was willing to direct me to a close parking lot for half the price, but there is absolutely no need to charge that much for parking. Overall, a business traveler hotel, don't bring your car!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but some staff let it down..”
Reviews.Author: Musclebearnz
Reviews.Content: The previous weekend to staying at the Intercontinental San Francisco, I stayed at the sister hotel in SF, the Mark Hopkins on Nob Hill. This kind of spoilt me and made it hard for anything else to follow. Likes: The location for a start, it was two blocks away from Market Street, so made it convenient for shopping, eating, public transport. The hotel was uber modern, room likewise, with big screen HDTV and Keurig coffee maker (albeit faulty), wouldnt make coffee, just hot water for tea, so tea it was. The view from my corner room was stunning.. 180 degreee city views, with floor to ceiling windows, again, stunning... Dislikes: As I look like a remnant from a 70's rock band, I got treated like I shouldnt have been there, staff looked sideways, didnt know whether to speak. Unlike the Mark Hopkins up the road where you are treated like a star. Lots of stuffy people around, black suits, curly wire ear pieces, looking important, with no interaction. Same with the doormen, a bit indifferent, sometimes you get a greeting, sometimes not, most of the time you have to open the door yourself. A real noisy afterwork bar at the end of the lobby. A real big one was you couldnt sleep in after 8am, because the housemaid servicing the rooms around you were in and out of the rooms letting the doors slam closed onto the extended dead bolt bar, to prevent the door shutting, so it was a constant, bang... bang... bang... In the end I just got up. Same for putting your "do not disturb" on, the staff would still knock on the door, or ring you up, so no getting an afternoon napp. The checking in/checking out process was uneventful, staff almost mechanical. Dont get me wrong, they werent rude, they were efficient, did their job well, just not particularly welcoming. Im a Platinum Ambassador member with this chain and see lots of hotels in the Intercontinental group, this is a great hotel, let down by the lack of that personal warm experience, like you get up the road at the Intercontinental Mark Hopkins.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Moira1304
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were exceptional, they advised on fantastic restaurants, day trips and even knew where I could get a decent manicure! Nothing was too much trouble and the club lounge was a pleasant spot for a pre-dinner drink, again with helpful and friendly staff who were polite and helpful. The rooms were well appointed and the hotel is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Energy Star Hotel Great Views at Higher floors, close to mall area”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and modern, flat screen tv, great surround view in corner rooms, the higher you go the view gets better. There is a mall Westfield that is about 5 minutes away walking, all kinds of food and really cool escalator.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, pleasant experience even w. high parking fee!”
Reviews.Author: nbm5b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental with my 2 children for part of our spring break. The hotel is easy to get to and close to the Moscone center (I may come back next year for a conf!). I didn't use public transportation while at this hotel (I rented, parked, and paid the nutty parking fees!). I'm glad I rented a car since it rained hard for this leg of the trip. We ate breakfast buffet both mornings - very good. Staff were nice and helpful. The room clean. The view was nice - would have been better if it hadn't been raining so much! I enjoyed the hotel. Kids liked it too (and they are picky). I'd say it's really designed more as a conf hotel with its proximity to Moscone. It has a bar that I would have gone to if I had been meeting friends for drinks (instead of shuttling kids to various locations around town). I also stayed at the Westin SF on Market - and the Intercontinental is nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, minimalistic city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alka15
Reviews.Content: Great location. Not far from the shopping mall and attractions in San Fran. Food was a bit pricey, but it's America - eat out!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Cant beet the distance to Moscone”
Reviews.Author: Sagees
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental on Howard street at the beginning of April. I was in for an internet conference that was hosted in Moscone West Center. It must have been no more than 150 ft from door to door. It was simply as convenient possible. Also the westfield mall is also only a 5 min walk away in case you need to get something. The bed and willows were great, so was the shower. I asked for a high floor and got a room on the 23rd. That made for some great views of the SF bay. I did not spend too much time in the room, but the floor to ceiling windows did allot for some eye soothing images. Check in was very smooth. The rate was also reasonable in comparison to the other hotels there. I paid $220 a night before tax. They do charge you $15/day on wi-fi which i think is a joke now a days. On check out i was surprised to find some bogus charges. There was a meal charge for an entire lunch for two or three people on me when i visited the restaurant once and had 2 coffees. There were also some false mini bar charges that i believe resulted from moving some bottles around to place a beverage of my own. In any case, the rep at concierge just had me look the charges over and anything that was not familiar was immediately canceled no questions asked. Elevator was always quick and never had to wait for a lift. The only frustrating issue with my stay had nothing to do with the hotel. There are no cabs in SF. Its nuts. I had to wait 45 minutes for a cab at 7:30 at night on the way to dinner. The street were empty, so it was not a traffic issue. All in all, great stay. Sagee

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with family, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Robgut
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in SF while we stayed at this hotel. We chose it because of its close location to the cable car, Chinatown, and Union Square. The concierges were the best I've ever interacted with, especially Bill Sutton (the chef concierge) and Hilga. I called them several times from various locations throughout the city and they always offered excellent advice. The hotel was extremely clean and well run, and all of the staff were very friendly and warm. The pool was a big reason we chose this place, and my kids (6 and 16) both loved it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal on Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: Mizzou93
Reviews.Content: Our family of two adults and two children, ages 9 and 11, stayed at this hotel for part of a Northern California family vacation for three nights, April 1 - 4, 2012. I booked it through Hotwire at a rate of $155.00 per night, and for that price we got a fabulous deal. The Hotwire listing stated "4.5 Star Hotel, Union Square West, Moscone Center." I was pretty sure we would get the InterContinental and we are so glad we did! I used a website called "Better Bidding" to help me predict we'd get the InterContinental - so helpful! It was my first experience using Hotwire, and I was expecting to be assigned to a low-level room by a noisy elevator. Upon check-in, we were thrilled to learn we had been upgraded to an 18th floor bay-view room. Our room was spotlessly clean, quiet (with the occasional sound of a fire truck, but it was San Francisco we chose to stay in!), and the double beds were very comfortable. (The sheets and bedding were even more comfortable to me than that of the Ritz-Carlton Half Moon Bay, which was the hotel we went to after our stay here - so kuddos to the InterContinental!) My only wish was for queen beds, not doubles, in the rooms. (The Ritz had doubles, too, by the way.) The location of this hotel met our needs quite well. Since we knew it would be about $50.00 to park a car we did not rent one. I would recommend to all families traveling in San Francisco to not rent a car, not only because of the expense, but it's very stressful to navigate around a busy city like SF with all of the bus lanes, speeding taxi cabs and people. It was a $10.00 cab fare to Pier 33 to do Alcatraz, and about $20.00 to the Exploratorium. We definitely saved money and aggravation by not renting a car. Because of expense, we only dined once at the hotel restaurant and it was for the breakfast buffet. We had met a very nice fellow guest at the pool one evening who gave us his two adult breakfast vouchers he wouldn't be using. Since the hotel breakfast buffet costs $28.00 per adult, this was another huge savings for us and we were so thankful! The cost for each of our children was $18.00 and we enjoyed a delicious buffet with fabulous service - a very special breakfast! On other mornings, we dined at a nearby Denny's, Starbucks and Mel's Diner - all within a block of the hotel. There are many, many restaurants within walking distance of this hotel. We walked to dinner one night at a great seafood restaurant called Anchor and Hope - wonderful food and very different from the seafood we get at home in Atlanta! =) We also dined in the food court of the mall one evening. I am typically NOT a food court fan, but this one was unique and upscale. One evening we were all so exhausted from our day of touring that we used hotel room service for dinner. We had great pasta dinners and the prices were reasonable, considering it was room service. We had taken our own bottled waters to the hotel with us and never consider using a hotel mini-bar. We visited the hotel indoor pool and hot tub a couple of times. It is a smallish, two or three lane pool but served our purposes well as our 9-year-old is a competitive year-round swimmer and needed to keep up with his training. We very much appreciated that the hotel had goggles for loan at the pool - a nice touch of the hotel. We had never stayed in an InterContinental before and were overall thrilled with our choice. I am SO GLAD that we stayed here and not at one of the hotels in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Though the Wharf area is where we spent much of our time, I found the InterContinental to be a quiet, restful place after full day of touring the city. There were very few other children in this business-oriented hotel. Because of this, we never encountered any screaming, ill-behaved children running up and down the hallways of this hotel or playing in elevators as we have in many other "family-oriented" hotels in which we've stayed. We were able to have a peaceful, enjoyable stay. I would definitely choose this hotel for a future San Francisco stay - Hotwire deal or not.

Reviews.Title: “Another Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: lawg8r
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the InterContinental San Francisco, and it was wonderful. We stayed in a junior suite, which is large and has floor to ceiling windows that gave us an incredible view of the city. The Club Level Lounge was fantastic, and the staff was so attentive. All of the concierges we spoke with were incredibly knowledgeable. What I found most impressive was that, although the President of the US stayed in the hotel one night while we were there, we did not notice a decline in service to regular guests. We will undoubtedly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay while in town for a conference”
Reviews.Author: trigirl2011
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Interncontinental SF while I was in the city for business. I stayed there for a total of 6 nights and enjoyed my stay. The room was spacious, the bed was comfortable and the sound levels (my room faced Howard) weren't too bad. However, if you are a light sleeper, request a room on one of the higher floors. The location in Yerba Buena is a 15 minute walk from Union Square and the hotel is conveniently located. A Starbucks is just around the corner. Be careful walking South-West on Howard as the area gets a bit sketchy after dark. If you stay East of 5th, you should be fine. I used the hotel pool a couple of times and it was a bit short (maybe less than 25 yards) and the temperature was a bit warm for lap swimming. The gym looked pretty new and the spa located on the 6th floor was frequented a lot. The fridge has a tiny spot to keep your food and all of the mini bar items, bottled water etc. are on electronic sensors so be careful unless you want a charge on your bill. If you want the fridge sensors deactivated, it will cost you around $30. Wireless is $14.95/24 hour period but the price per day is less if you purchase the 3- or 5-day package. All in all, I enjoyed my stay and would recommend the Interncontinental if you are attending a conference at the Moscone. It's right beside Moscone West and just a small block away from Moscone South.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dreams”
Reviews.Author: docnoo
Reviews.Content: Extremely pleasant personnel. Room was clean and enjoyed the gym and pool but didn't use the spa. Massage available. A little on the heavy side when it came to buying a tube of pretzels in the room. $9.00 for pretzels and $8.00 for a bottle of water. Easier to go across the street to the local deli and order a sandwich and coffee. Go to Mel's diner around the corner for breakfast. Location is near the cable car off Market Street. Tremendous restaurants in Little Italy. Avoid Chinatown as it is filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steph M
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay while visiting San Francisco! Such a modern hotel, with helpful and friendly staff. Pretty good location within walking distance to many sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Daybright
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few truly modern hotels in the city. They let us check in at 9:30 am, and even though we got the deal through Hotwire, they gave us 2 rooms, on higher floor, as we requested. The location is close to Union Square and Bart station, and yet just a little distance away from the hubbub. We were there for business and convention, and the main floor provided a perfect place for meetings as well. Courteous staff, good internet, convenient location, and great views.

Reviews.Title: “A bit on the average side”
Reviews.Author: WorkTraveler27
Reviews.Content: Was booked here for a convention; stayed on the 8th floor and my room was "upgraded" because that was all they had left....does that make anyone feel special? The room was indeed large with a shower and a tub and two beds. Was tempted to have the disgusting orange upholstered chair with countless stains removed from my room but opted to just turn the ottoman over top of it so I didn't have to look at it. Ick! The view was of the street which being in the city was very loud. A generator humming, sirens, screaming out on the street but the bed was half way decent so I was able to sleep. Found the energy saving lights a bit annoying and the room not well lit and since it was cloudy all week the sun wasn't helping out despite the wall of windows overlooking the street. The staff were all friendly and helpful short of the reception desk whom I found cold and robotic. It's as if they are on auto play and auto smile, no sincerity. And the downstairs lobby was extremely loud when the bar was full and the bar was immediately adjacent to the elevator lobby. Poor planning if you ask me. Would I choose to stay again, no. But given its location and walking distance to so many things one might consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...plus & minus”
Reviews.Author: MariaBCaro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at This hotel last week. Hotel has good location, you can walk to union square and pick up easy transportation everywhere. Great shopping mall and stores everywhere near hotel. Hotel is nice looking, not too fancy. Service is excellent. Staff was super friendly. Room was on 31st floor, on the small side. Decoration was good. Bathroom was great except for the slide glass door. Was not a fan of the bathroom door but bathroom had a nice big tub and shower. Bed was horrible. not a good mattress. Views of the city where nice. Upgrade to club was worth it. Nice breakfast in a nice club room. did not try lunch or dinner but there are free drinks at night which made up for the upgrade price. Spa was small but massage was amazing. Again, very friendly staff. Room had a snack bar, a plus. Only two complain: no bottled water at the club level to take to your room ( there was plenty of sodas to take out) and our room was next to elevators and it was noisy. Overall: friendly staff, location, and good price, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An "open wallet" hotel”
Reviews.Author: James L
Reviews.Content: As a gold priorityclub member, one can tell I favor Holiday Inn brands. I can't, however, figure out why "high end" hotels need to nickel and dime (or dollar) you at every turn. After all, I stayed for a "special" conference fare of $259, much reduced from the more typical $300+. Much less expensive places (but still nicely appointed in good locations) have free wireless, at least for priorityclub members, give you a bottle water or two when you check in, upgrade your room when they have availability, and have a decent business center where you can access the internet and do some limited printing. Don't look for any of this at the InterContinental SF. In your room, a bottle of Fiji water will cost you $6; I don't even want to think what they might charge for an ounce of gin from the mini-bar. Wireless in your room is $15/day, business center is standing only with substantial charges just to log on and print a few pages. (At least you can print a boarding pass for free). Parking is insane -- $59/day once you add in the tax. I was briefly afraid they would charge me for the little plastic bags that they gave out for umbrellas when you came in out of the rain. The lobby and bar area is small and very noisy ... and you can't avoid it since it's right in front of the elevators. The breakfast buffet at Luce is excellent, lots of fresh fruit, traditional breakfast fare (I liked the genuine maple syrup), etc. Just like everywhere else, have an open wallet attitude. The buffer will set you back like a typical dinner entree -- $28. The plus side is easy access to the Mosconi center. My trip was for a conference there. Also, the staff at the hotel is extraordinary. Friendly, helpful, always smiling, ever attentive -- they embody what one would hope all hotel staff would strive for. I expect you will be treated right if you choose this hotel. Overall, the hotel is not a bad choice, particularly for business trips that involve the Mosconi center. Just be prepared to open your wallet early and often.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time, gr8 restaraunt”
Reviews.Author: Alexander N
Reviews.Content: Too expensive for that kind of hotel. It was crowded in lobby all the time in the evenings, people was too loud.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: iocat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what it seems like, a premium-priced, high-quality service hotel in San Francisco. It's south of Market and everything you want in the city is ultimately a pretty easy walk from here. It's especially convenient to Moscone Center, and I think it makes a better base than the W (full of Wouchebags) or the St Regis, which has no easily accessible ground floor cafe for casual meetings or coffee. I also like it more than the Marriott, but that's just my personal tastes. (It's newer and a little more minimalist in style, and there are fewer street people right out front -- just a nicer block). It is pricey, and paying $16/day for wifi makes me want to scream, but that's what you get with expense account hotels. Rooms are clean and well appointed, good TV, good Internet access (I think wired or wireless -- I just used wifi), and very attentive helpful staff (the amount of stuff I've had delivered here or made them store is, well, a lot.) The cafe is very good, and they don't mind if you just get coffee, which is good, because most of my convention experience is just that. I've held a couple of small events here and found the price pretty reasonable for SF, and the catering staff, etc. was excellent. Protip: If you don't want to drop $28 on the hotel breakfast, the little deli across the street is quite good -- better than it looks -- if you just want a breakfast sandwich or bagel.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: Sasha122156
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights. Hotel is close to the Convention Center and a short walk from the Market Square, shopping etc. Everything was supurb and better than expected. Staff is wonderful, polite, helpful, not noisy. Room was spacious, spotless, Wi-Fi worked flawlessly. A/C worked quietly, did not bother at all. The whole establishment is better than the Marriot Hotel across the street I used to stay at. The restaurant is overpriced though in my opinion. Entrees look great but that is it. I did not find them particularly tasty. Appertizers were good though.

Reviews.Title: “50/50”
Reviews.Author: LUXChicago
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Mark Hopkins for many years and are Ambassador members, but decided to try this hotel for one night before returning from Wine Country to the airport the next day. We both have conflicted thoughts about a return visit. As other reviewers stated, the location would be OK for convention business, but not so great for anything else in the area; including the fact that it is an isolated peninsula in the Tenderloin District. We absolutely did not venture out at night. Touting LEED and "green" is cliched and pushing the limits at times. The towels were wrinkled, thin and did not look clean. I cut three fingers on the sliding glass bathroom door (glass is not a good idea for a bathroom, as is the lack of a fan for privacy). There were no functioning windows and we kept joking that a fire truck was going to pull up outside our window all night, even though we were on the 23rd floor--needs some noise control. We had a lovely room service dinner, but when we finished up our water, I noticed that the drinking glasses were filthy. Other pet peeves; no urn of coffee in the lobby to grab and go early the next morning, no free Internet, lack of room outlets, no mirror in the room for grooming, telephones that require a PhD to utilize; not to mention the annoying advertisements flashing on a 6"x4" telephone screen and no Sunday newspaper. This hotel is good for young hipsters or nouveau riche who are not yet educated in customer service, although the staff was professional and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: trumpedfinally
Reviews.Content: Even for an Intercontinental Hotel the service was better than expected. Concierge, front desk, doormen and others were always looking to help, but not in a disturbing way. Terrific staff. We were upgraded to a corner room on a high floor, the views were great and the room size very large. The room was made up early in the morning (before 11 am) every day which was helpful for us as we came back a couple of times during the day to rest from all the walking. The location was perfect, we could walk to almost anywhere downtown and it was only a couple of blocks from the cable car.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Intercontinental (meant in a good way!)”
Reviews.Author: SwissFella
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a smart, modern hotel in downtown San Francisco, with easy access to transport options - this could be the place for you. It's pricey, especially if you add on the extravagant extras for internet, phone calls and breakfast. And, of course, tax! But in a city which is a magnet for conventions and incentive travel, rates can shoot up and down to match demand. Getting locked into a high advanced purchase (no refund on cancellation) can be a gamble, as these rates can be artificially high - only to drop closer to the date to fill the hotel, so that you end up paying far more than the flexible rate ruling on the arrival day. But that's not unique to this hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful, rooms bright and comfortable. The immediate area is OK but far from the best: you might not want to venture further South of Market when the streets are empty. Powell BART station is only a couple of blocks north, on Market - so transport to and from the airport is easy for those without too much baggage. Powell is also a MUNI station, so you can get around town quite easily. Bloomingdales is in the large shopping mall between the hotel and Market street, and you can walk quite comfortably along Market street to the Embarcadero Ferry Terminal market/shopping/eating area. Walking the other direction the atmosphere deteriorates quickly. Crssing Market you are within easy reach of Union Square and (a little further) Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “New and Modern makes for a nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: KKrisC
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my 3 nights stay here. It's New and Modern which is not common for SF hotel. I liked how everything was clean and fresh. My standard room was big and comfortable. The location is convenient - close to downtown museums and Union Square. Everyone was helpful and professional. The bar was a great place to sit and sip while relaxing your tired feet from walking up and down the hills of SF.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugBR
Reviews.Content: For such level of hotel and price, would expect free internet as standard, not dirty glasses or ripped towel in the room. Bedding was excelent, location is convenient, specially if your target is Market St, Moscone Center or Union Square regions. Was a winter weekend with no big event and receptionist didn't manage to find us a high floor room. Also expected more from Michelin starred restaurant Luce on ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient start for exploring museum and down-town”
Reviews.Author: ElettraStuttgart
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location close to SFMOMA, the park and Market street. I suggest to have breakfast at the close Starbuck as the hotel breakfast is quite expensive. Comfortable and large rooms with good insonorisation. State-of-the art bathroom with all necessary amenities. Check-in / out quick and professional. Nice bar lounge for a night cup.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad and a couple of ugly's”
Reviews.Author: PerfectStay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, clean and fresh and have the majority of the amenities that you should be looking for like a good restaurant, a gym, a fancy bar and good size rooms with fantastic beds. Service is depending on what person you speak with and is ranging from average to very good. The 3 things that put me down was that first of all the sound from the outside was terrible. I was located on the 9th floor and the cars was constantly honking their horn on the street outside thru the whole day, the man who brought in the taxis was blowing his whistle, but the worst was the fire trucks. I don’t know if the hotel was located next to the fire station, but the extremely loud sirens woke me up several times both nights during my stay. It also was a bit further to walk than what I had expected. I was under the impression that it was located on Union Square, but in order to get to union square it’s about a 10 minute walk. Not that it’s terribly long to walk for 10 minutes, but there is not much to do right outside the hotel so you must walk a good 5-10 minutes to come to decent bars, restaurants and shops (but then you are in the dead center of it) I also find it surprising that they charge me a quite stiff price for using the internet. We are living in 2012 and in the same way as I don’t expected to be charged extra for the TV, using the water and the electricity, I don’t expect to be charged to use the internet. I didn’t try the breakfast, but it was quite expensive, looked fresh with a more “high-end” selection, but not a huge buffet. All in all an ok stay, but due to the things menstioned above and the fact that I paid a pretty stiff price I’ll pick another hotel next time. PS: Location I great for close access for the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but”
Reviews.Author: burrard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights in early March. Room was small but well decorated and comfortable, staff were helpful and eager to help. My complaints are minimal but reflect onareas where the hotel couple improve. The toilet flush handle was broken and hard to operate we informed the front desk but nothing was done to fix the problem. Towels were cheap and certainly not four star quality. I object to paying $15 a day for Wifi when even cheap motels include it in the cost of a $70 room. Agood hotel but it could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RichmondLily
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for a business conference and had a great stay at this hotel. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The beds were incredibly comfortable and I did not have one bad nights sleep. A Keurig coffee maker is provided in the room which I really enjoyed. The staff are all very attentive and helpful. The breakfast buffet, while pricey, is good. Location-wise, you're close to everything you could want to be close to. Use the concierge - they are very helpful and gave great recommendations. I enjoyed the city and I enjoyed my stay at The Intercontinental. I would definitely stay here again and am considering it next month when I'm bringing the kids for Spring Break.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: mollybecky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here for the weekend for a working vacation. This is a very nice property with friendly and attentive staff. It's quiet and close to everything. Nice large rooms and great club level facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionDaddy
Reviews.Content: With a location a block from the Moscone Center and a couple of blocks from Union Square, this hotel is ideally located for visiting during a convention or large meeting. The rooms are great and totally functional, the gym is top notch and the service is great. This is my go to place in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhaigh
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in good location. Worth a visit. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Should be much better!”
Reviews.Author: swankyhotels
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend at this hotel. The hotel itself is nice in a big convention hotel sort of way. But the communication and remedy of bad situations is not good. We checked in and decided to pay for a club room. The room was small and had only a little window instead of the floor to ceiling windows advertised. We changed rooms to a regular corner room which was spectacular. But there were boxes left from the prior guest on the desk, minibar bottles missing and at 11 PM we discovered that the blackout curtains were not functioning. (not good for an east facing window!). I let management know and the boxes were removed and the curtain fixed at midnight. We barely slept that first night because the mattress felt very lumpy. The next morning I requested that the mattress be changed. They don't have any spare mattresses on this enormous property! So they removed the feather-bed and it was much better. Still, I'd expect excellent rather than mediocre mattresses at an intercontinental. The wifi didn't work, and I called to let the front desk know. There was nothing they could do. When we checked out, we were billed for the minibar and the wifi. There were no notes about our complaints and management did nothing to make it right. I had been talking to my boyfriend earlier, assuming that the hotel would do something (buy us breakfast, apologize, or something) to make things right. He asked whether I was just trying to get something for free. I thought about it and explained that no, what I wanted was the opportunity to leave the hotel thinking good things about it instead of negative ones. When things go wrong, a hotel can make it right with small compensations that don't cost them much if anything. But this hotel did not. Not even having a record of the problems and having to bring up the minibar and internet situation at checkout was disappointing. So overall, I have to give it a poor rating for customer service and internal communication. Too bad they didn't make it right... Perhaps the hotel is too large to truly be good, let alone excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my Stay”
Reviews.Author: CMG1984
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property, with spacious hotel rooms and bathrooms you will never wish to leave. The decor is contemporary, which I like very much. This hotel has all the amenities one could think of: Gym (middle-of-the-road equipment), room service (on time and good) and concierge (great service). I had breakfast at their restaurant, Luce, and enjoyed one of the best egg-white omelets I've ever eaten. I had a drink at their bar...the bartender definitely knew how to make a dirty martini. The location was slightly outside of the main corridor - south of Market Street. Having said that, the hotel was still very much within walking distance of everything. I walked to North Beach and to the Ferry building - took me about 25 minutes and 20 minutes, respectively. If you're not a city dweller, the sirens could disrupt your sleep. Otherwise, I could not hear my upstairs, downstairs or next door neighbors. lastly, service was excellent with a very helpful concierge desk to a wonderful houskeeping team. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get much better”
Reviews.Author: GaerielSky
Reviews.Content: This was my second (and won't be the last) time staying at the Intercontinental during the SFIGF. It's really close to the Moscone Center and there are a lot of great shopping/dinning places withing a couple of blocks. Hotel is clean. Upon check in (Room 2523) housekeeping even phoned to check if I needed anything, if the room was to my satisfaction. They replenished the toiletries the first night, just in case. Lovely spacious room. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean. Convenient. Restaurant has a delicious buffet breakfast as well. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Big Surprise on 5th and Howard!”
Reviews.Author: joan g
Reviews.Content: I spent the long weekend presenting workshops at the San Francisco Writer's Conference which took place at the Mark Hopkins on Nob Hill. At the last minute, my husband and I decided to spend the night downtown instead of going back and forth to our home in Monterey Heights. We were matched to the Intercontinental by Hotwire. It was fantastic! The room was luxurious, well designed, beautifully appointed. The bathroom was spotless and had fabulous, organic amenities. The best thing of all is that the whole hotel is LEED gold certified - which means that they use only green cleaning products - so the place is good if you have any sort of chemical sensitivity. Room service arrived in the morning with HOT coffee - the whole stay - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: voyou
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the InterContinental on two different occasions this month. I'm surprised to read that others were disappointed with the service, because that was clearly the best part of our stay. Staff was very accommodating, giving us an upgrade on our room and the view we requested. We rented a car through the hotel and the concierge staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but clearly for us great service made our stay a pleasant one. The fitness center is great, particularly the lap pool and the jacuzzi. The restaurant is very good, with friendly service. It's a good hotel for business travelers who want no fuss, comfortable accomodations, in particular those attending conferences at the Moscone Center next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jessie D
Reviews.Content: Great bar, fitness center was sweet - rooms were clean and modern. Location was great - right off union square. Perfect spot for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: knippy
Reviews.Content: Hate this hotel. Off the beaten path. Once you do get there nothing spectacular. But the ringer is the inept service. One day into a weekend stay after a long day on the prowl, returned to discover our key card locked out. My husband went to the desk for new keys but as the reservation wasn't under his name they wouldn't help him without me. Front desk calls the room...which I am outside of in the hall locked out...to confirm the situation. Long story short, I went to the desk, 2 new keys...neither work. Now security involved. More 'identity confirmation'. Ridiculous. Will not ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, clean great food leisure facilities.”
Reviews.Author: IrelandQwerty
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel, excellent leisure and business facilities. Rooms large with all luxuries. A little bit saucy charging $15 per day for wireless (although fast speeds) in view of cost per room. Otherwise would recommend again, staff always friendly and relaxed atmosphere, food excellent, breakfast sumptuous and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, eventhough not sure @ 1st”
Reviews.Author: Traya
Reviews.Content: Wasn't crazy about area/location at 1st. Turned out great. Loved the bed and bathroom. They have a bar @ 1st floor, no soccer games :-( The chieftains restaurant across the street made the difference for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean, Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: mlwtravel
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay. The staff was very friendly, upgraded our room and got us a great view of the city. The room was very clean also. The bed was quite comfortable too. The location can't be beat. Easy to get to with lots of restaurants nearby. I would highly recommend staying here. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Better than average. I recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Cugiemon
Reviews.Content: When visiting San Francisco it is good to be centrally located. While the INTCON is just south of Union Square, it is still in a great location for most everything. When booking this hotel, I was surprised at how cheap it was. I really did not expect a lot from it based on its price. With a happening bar in the lobby and very comfortable accommodations, it is a great hotel for business or pleasure. We were staying there to see the giants play. I had stayed at the Marriott just a couple of blocks over and the price was almost double. This is not the most amazing hotel, but for me it is a great place if you are in town for one or two nights with other stuff to do besides hang out in bed all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: onthecoaster
Reviews.Content: This is a super Hotel with super Staff. Ms Brigette Ramirez Guest Relations Agent is due commendation and significant asset to the Hotel. I requested a high floor room and was given one on the 28th floor with a magnificent view and spotless top class facilities. Big room, seating area at the huge window, desk work area, very comfortable King size bed with lots of pillows and high qulity bedsheets, huge TV, and massive ensuite. There are lots of lifts for speedy access up or down. The Bar on the ground floor is excellent. The Breakfast Room on the ground floor is most comfortable being seated and looked after by great Staff. The huge glass of fresh orange juice to start is most welcome and the buffet breakfast choices are a great start to the day. The fitness facilities and pool on the 6th flloor are superb.Reception and Concierge Staff are really up to the job and the Hotel Doorman Ernest Baskin Jr is the best I've ever experienced. The Hotel is superbly placed for local restaurants (try Mel's Diner) and visiting places of interest including a Trip to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf on the Cable Cars. Out of the Hotel front door turn right and right again at the traffic lights keep on walking and in five minutes you are bang in the middle of the central shopping area. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the InterContinental and havee no hesitation inecommending it - I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: Breanne C
Reviews.Content: Wow, you would think the staff would be trained on how to answer a question like "where is the pool?". I spoke to three different people about where the pool was, and none knew. The woman in the business office didnt know, and didnt offer to find out, the girl in the gift shop did the same thing, she didnt even know that there was a map less that thirty feet away which wouldve answered my question. The only one with an excuse was another woman who was working her first day there, and she wouldve helped had she not been stationed by a door for security, but she did tell us where the map was. Very unprofessional. Fantastic view though.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view from a room and smart location”
Reviews.Author: retina66
Reviews.Content: It stands right next to a convention center and easy to walk to subway station, department stores and Union SQ, all in 10 min-walk. Like usual InterCOntinental, everything is neat and good shape. It is a modern building with lots of glasses in and out. 1. Room Room is clean as well as a bathroom. Desk and chairs are modern and comfortable. There is no window but one side room is glass wall that you can see the city. View was fantastic, specailly at night. With same reason, curtain should be used in daytime for you own personal securities. 2. Lobby It looks very modern and loud since there are one bar in middle of lobby. 3, Fitness It has few treadmills and others for cardio-work. I saw some facilities for pilates also. On the other side of fitness room, indoor pool was located, separated by window. Water temp was adjusted for instant dipping. All facilites are well maintained. The most impression comes from the view from the room cos one side of room is an entire glass wall. Location is excellent also. It was easy for shopping, museums, conference and so on. I felt lack of restaurant in this area though, I might look at wrong direction or area. Overall, I was very satisfied to stay here for 5 nights and I had a great time here. I paid $150 total per night and I was happy to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great fitness facility, close enough to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: CincyOHTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newer (less than 5 years old, I believe) and was modern and comfortable. The fitness area was good, and I loved the 2 lane lap pool.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good service, great views”
Reviews.Author: trippyNYC
Reviews.Content: stayed here during a conference week but didn't notice any glitches or slow service. conveniently next to moscone center. booked a jr suite which is an extra large guestroom but on a corner. floor to ceiling windows on 2 sides including length of the bathroom. flat screen tv is set up on the bureau/desk system blocks beautiful views of the city. also with so much length of window treatments, would be nice if they were automated. could hear voices thru vents or something and street noise that was audible was mostly emergency vehicles. bedding was very comfy, down comforter and pillowtop bed. towels and robe weren't super-plush but the slippers were stretchy and fit snug to my feet, unlike most other hotel slippers that could make you trip any second cuz they're so floppy. hotel is very eco. toiletries were some sort of organic eco brand. faucets and shower were pretty low pressure. this room included access to the intercontinental club. breakfast in the club was pretty good with cooked eggs and bacon plus pastries, fruit, yogurt, cold cuts etc. even with the conference going on, didn't have a problem getting a table at bfast at all. seemed busiest during happy hour. overall food/snacks offered throughout the day (lunch soup, afternoon tea sandwiches, happy hour eats, night-time sweets) were pretty good. staff in the club were attentive and very friendly. gym was standard hotel setup (treadmills, precor, bike. weight machines, dumbbells) and a little on the small side. looked pretty crowded whenever i saw it tho i used the pool more. i think pool is 50ft, 2 lanes. never had to share a lane. was pleased that it wasn't over-run with kids too much, as hotel pools can be. pool users--please shower before entering the pool!! if i can smell your perfume while i'm in the water when you walk by, you have too much crap on your body and i don't want to be swimming in that filth you bring into the pool. got a steak room service one night, with fried polenta. was very well prepared. i hate polenta but this stuff tasted like creamy ricotta in a fried skin, delicious. another night got some spaghetti bolognese delivered to the club. both times food arrived surprisingly fast, just like ordering at a restaurant. for something different, on Wed and Fri lunch, off the grid food trucks are around the corner in an alley off 5th on minna. on nice days, the outdoor public terrace on 6th floor is a pleasant quiet spot to hang out. hotel is a little off the main drag but great for moscone events. misses some of the little things like turn-down and bedtime water like four seasons and st regis etc but would say the service, sleep comfort, food are pretty up there. plus the corner room views are much better priced than st regis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller198526
Reviews.Content: What an absolute gem of a hotel in San Francisco! Stayed here at the start of the New Year and loved every minute. Check in was very efficient and the lovely girl on reception gave me a room on the 24th floor which afforded some great views over the city. Al, the security guard, always seemed to be on duty and was an asset to the hotel. He was forever chatting to guests and making everyone feel truly welcome. He certainly made us feel welcome and gave us some great tips of things to do towards the end of our stay. Bar staff were also really friendly and never let my beer glass go empty. Erik was great at chatting away and the Restaurant Manager Keit was friendly too. The bar is a great place to spend a few hours in an evening, and the grappa collection is something to marvel at. All in all, an excellent hotel and it would probably be my top choice for coming back to San Francisco again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a modern Aesthetic”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in Soma near Moscone Center. Rooms are immaculately clean and quite roomy. They are tastefully decorated in a modern design with a great bathroom. My only warning is that the valet parking is $55. Look around the hotel for cheaper outdoor parking lots.

Reviews.Title: “South of Market but convenient to Moscone Center”
Reviews.Author: Orso52
Reviews.Content: This hotel served as the "overflow" hotel for the 2012 ASCO GU meeting, which itself was held at the nearby Marriott Marquis. I am delighted that I was referred to this porperty. The rooms are spacious, the breakfast is excellent and the fitness facility is well equipped. The location just next to the Moscone Convention Center is ideal for the conference traveler

Reviews.Title: “Decent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYEm
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is clean, accessible, and does the job. The rooms are on the smaller side (compared to the Four Seasons San Francisco and other Intercontinental hotels), but the bathrooms are more spacious relative to the actual bedrooms. The room I was in only had a shower, so you are not guaranteed a bathtub. The bathroom products no name products and the hotel doesn't give you much. The TV is flat screen, the bed comfortable, but the closet and rooms are, on the whole, small. The higher floors however, do offer impressive views of San Fransisco, so that can be a nice perk. The bar scene is hopping at night, as it's clearly a popular business hotel - everyone there was in a suit. Drinks and bar snacks were good. The late night room service menu doesn't have many options, and the food isn't very good anyway. Breakfast in the hotel's first floor restaurant is, however, wonderful. The a la carte menu and the buffet options were both extensive and the fruit is very fresh. Service at the table was nothing special, but the hotel staff was very hospitable in letting us leave out bags in another area while we ate before checkout. All in all, the Intercontinental is clean and a fine option. The staff is friendly and the service is prompt. It's just not quite as good as other comparable options, and it's a bit more "no frills" than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, GREAT view!”
Reviews.Author: LKMartin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the intercontinental SFO on a business trip in January- hotel is conveniently located downtown within reasonable walking distance to the waterfront, Chinatown, and just a block from the Moscone West convention center. I had a room on the 28th floor with a FANTASTIC view of the city. Rooms are clean and nicely appointed- bed was very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and allowed me to check in early. There is a gym on the 6th floor that is open 24h which is very convenient, and provides water and fruit as well. The lobby bar is a nice meeting spot (try the Italian mojito) but if you really want to be blown away, head to the View bar on the 39th floor of the Marriott (a couple blocks away)!

Reviews.Title: “Great meeting hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaExplorer
Reviews.Content: We just had a Foundation board meeting here and they did everything very well. the food was good and the space was just as we planned it. This is also a very good location if you plan to attend any conventions as it is right down the street from the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and just a 2 block walk to all the shopping and touristy stuff at Market St. and Union Square and right next to the convention center. The bar had a good selection of high end gin and they knew how to make a martini. Room was nice but typical big city pricing. I paid over $300 per night with a special symposium pricing package. Didn't get a chance to try the restaurant that is supposed to have a Michelin star. One nice feature is that when leaving for the airport, the doorman directed me to the hotel car that took me to SFO for the same price as the cabs charge ($45 + tip) and provided a much nicer ride. Great little Irish pub directly across the street. One issue: if you're a light sleeper, there must be a fire station nearby or San Fran has a lot of emergencies as there was almost constant siren presence during the stay that was quite loud even on the 17th floor where I stayed. Also, there was a power outage for several hours that effected several blocks of San Fran. The hotel handled it well, having people on every floor to calm people and stationed at key point in stairwells to direct traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great food!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyBeeking
Reviews.Content: This hotel serves the best food! The breakfast is very expensive, but also very good. I've been in this hotel about 4 times now and they never let you down. Also try the burger in the bar, its exceptional! The rooms are very nice and clean. I got an upgrade once to a corner room which had lots of windows and a great modern look. The beds are also amazing. I had some trouble getting my SPG points for this hotel. Which is more a problem of the SPG program but that was a bit annoying. They also don't recognize that I already visited them a couple of times, which I think they can get out of the system. So a bit dissapointed with that, as I booked many groups and business meetings in this hotel over the years. The location is very convenient both for business as for trips. The Moscone Center is just a 3 minute walk!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay: Even Better Than the Wonderful Ones Before”
Reviews.Author: lily1646
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week over New Year’s Eve. As before, every staff member was gracious and attentive whether we were in the lobby (concierge & doormen), the Club Lounge, or the restaurant, Luce. Luce, is an example of what we especially enjoyed on this visit. We had heard it had received a Michelin star for the third year in a row, but we were delighted that the prices were comparable to other restaurants. We kept hearing from guests in the Club Lounge (more about the Club below), that the butter-poached lobster was “fabulous” (two guests had it two nights in a row) as well the John Dory, and other items. During our stay, we savored and can highly recommend the lobster, the John Dory, the diver scallop and abalone appetizer, the sweetbread ravioli and a soup with celeric, apples and coffee ice cream. I’ll write more about Luce under restaurants since it was such a positive experience. The hotel location was great, as always, but it was even more important to be so close to all of the tourist sites and public transportation because of the new, higher taxi costs and because I could get everywhere I needed to go with my sprained foot. We had a terrific corner room with floor to ceiling windows and a great view of the bay, the city, the Bay Bridge, and the New Year's Eve fireworks that were visible down at the end of Howard Street. **Recommendation: stay on a high floor with a better view; the corner rooms are the best. The Club Lounge, an oasis within the hotel, was even better than before. Although the food has always been delicious, it seemed there was increased focus on providing healthier, attractive appetizers that are more in line with the food served in Luce. Along with the assorted veggies and dip and cheese and crackers, there were freshly prepared treats such as tuna tartar along with additional cold items. One night, lobster claws were included. For the hot food, highlights were skewers of fish filets and some with chicken breast: neither had any breading or batter. The assortment was different every evening. Each time we passed through the Club, there was something to eat and beverages to enjoy: breakfast, soup-midday, teatime, evening appetizers and drinks, and then dessert with liquors. **Recommendation: upgrade to the Club for a more memorable, tasty stay. We made some great friendships with other guests and shared travel tips, too. Finally, one of the most important reasons why we stay here is that everyone always welcomes us (and everyone else) and they want to ensure that we have a wonderful, memorable stay. It’s just a very special place.

Reviews.Title: “Good for conferences”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller298
Reviews.Content: Very close to the conference center, facilities are pleasant including a nice pool and gym. Rooms are comfortable and quiet. Great city and bay views from the higher levels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in terms of location and service.”
Reviews.Author: WiggleOxford
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Intercontinental late on the evening of Thursday 12th January after a 25 hour trip from the UK via Dallas Fort Worth and we were very tired. We were located on the 26th floor with wonderful views of the city and harbour. The room was excellent and also we were able to use the internet access to skype back to the UK and elsewhere with a great reception and nil cost due to membership of Priority Club. Hotel staff were polite and were able to respond very quickly to requests. The in room coffee machine brewed excellent coffee etc and was a treat in the morning before breakfast. The hotel is just one block away from the Moscone centre where we attended the NASFT show. The hotel is part of the ICH group whilst not inexpensive the cost was well worth the convenience. Just one word of warning for those who choose to walk around, turning right out of the hotel main entrance and down the street a few blocks leads you to welfare missions and there are some pretty scary looking people who frequent this area as well as the HObos who seem to be everywhere in San Francisco. You just need to be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Close to Moscone Center”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while we were attending a trade show at the Moscone Center. Hotel is new and very clean with spacious rooms. Staff was polite and helpful. We were on the 31st floor and had a great city and bay view. You do not need a car in San Francisco but if you have one, park it yourself in lot behind the hotel and save a lot of money. Hotel charges $60 for parking.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to be SOMA, this is a nice choice”
Reviews.Author: John_Ell
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at W or Four Seasons when I have events at Moscone. But this is my second time here because the pricing has been right and I like the change. Very clean and minimalist decoration in public areas. Overall enjoyable surroundings. No drama, staff seems enthusiastic about working there, and any one of them seemed willing to help a guest. Really nice to get this kind of treatment in a major city at a more corporate style hotel. Staff anticipate what I need each day, and the bar and public areas are comfortable and great for meetings with clients. Luce is not bad. It is pretty expensive. They do the room service too. Room service menu kind of limited. Do get the apple cobbler. I'm telling you it's way better than you would think. Brief notes and asides about the gym, pool and spa: Gym nice, not heavily used, really nice equipment. Very clean. The pool and spa are in a separate room next to the gym at the end of a long hallway on the sixth floor. The pool/spa room is really sparse; no furniture, fluorescent lighting. Not for hanging out; just working out.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Junior suit views”
Reviews.Author: SBV7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my family for four nights in a Junior Suite. Outstanding city view from the suite in the 24th floor. Also I find it nice, clean, new and spacious. The Hotel is walking distance from downtown and you can go anywhere in the city using public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Adequate, Corporate”
Reviews.Author: Jestrada13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental this past weekend for two nights. The hotel is relatively new and is very clean. Overall my stay was fine. Here's a list of pros and cons: Pros: 1. Very Clean Room. 2. Spacious - I stayed in a room with a king size bed Cons: 1. The room is very plain with little personality. Similar to a Doubletree or Courtyard Marriott. 2. Not a lot of value for the room. We had to pay an extra $40/night to upgrade to a king bed. 3. Location - a few blocks south of Market Street with nothing much else on the block or across the street. Overall the staff was okay, not really friendly but helpful when I asked for something. My girlfriend mentioned that we were celebrating my birthday that weekend hoping to bait them into offering a free upgrade or at least free wi fi...no luck. We must be doing something wrong, since every time we travel, we never get any free upgrade offers. Even though there was nothing majorly wrong with the hotel, I think we will try a different one the next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Shinny and New”
Reviews.Author: William C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my family for three nights--adjoining rooms. Nice, clean, new and spacious. Bar was nice and service was good. Park your car and walk everywhere and anywhere in the city using great public transpo. Park in city public garage behind hotel and save $20 day! Enjoy the city by the bay...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: leoduan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here on the day after Christmas. Checked in around 9ish, hotel staff are very friendly, and we get the free upgrade to a higher and nicer suite, great view up there. Clean and beautiful, great duvet and sheet, love it. The location is very convenient too, close to everything, just a couple of mins walk to Howard street, union square, cable car. No free wi-fi, parking is expensive, try the public parking at the back will save you some $. The checkout is a bit slow, only 1 staff at the desk to handle all the check-ins and outs. Try the TV checkout if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: MontereyEater
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here and wished we could have stayed longer! The hotel in itself is incredible and so is the staff. Jason Ngo assisted me with our reservation and he went out of his way in order to make sure that everything was taken care of! Located of Howard street it is close to everything, ten minutes walk to union square and shops!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful building, amazing rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Viajeraenfamilia
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very friendly staff. Rooms are large with large plasma TVs and bathrooms are beautiful, nice towels and they even have a scale. We had time to work out at the gym which is just perfect size to keep your routine, and the pool and jacuzzi were the perfect spot after our loooong walks around the city. My husband an I spent a week last March while I was attending a conference and it was a great retreat to get back to after all our walks to Chinatown (walking distance), Lombard Street and we even walked to take the Ferry to Alcatraz. The restaurant was great for breakfast but if you want really good food please cross the street to Bucca and have great italian food. I would definetely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this place.”
Reviews.Author: Mcannie
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely room, fantastic staff, especially the lovely lady concierge. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend or return. Great rates over Xmas & New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but club services only so so”
Reviews.Author: lsdjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a club room with the family for 4 days at New Years. Rooms and facilities in great shape and this is a wonderful location very close to shopping. Staff experience was hit and miss - front desk check-in failed to set up our room keys to give us club lounge access and they had to be reminded to honor my ambassador status benefits for a room upgrade. Too their credit, once I noticed both issues they fixed it right away. The bell hop however was great and had good tips for everything from shopping to where to watch the fireworks show. Was truly disappointed in breakfast in the club lounge which had very few choices compared to the downstairs main buffet. I was thrilled that on 3 mornings the club lounge was full (it's tiny) and they instead gave us vouchers to the main restaurant (the main buffet breakfast is Outstanding!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - until we checked out and fraud was committed.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had enjoyed a wonderful time in San Francisco, and very much enjoyed the hospitality and facilities at this hotel. The concierge was especially helpful and overall, when we checked out, we had nothing but positivity in terms of our view of the hotel experience. This all changed as we checked out, we were informed by the member of staff at the front desk that we had a $70 charge for drinks from the mini-bar. We hadn't consumed any drinks from the mini-bar and disputed this with the member of staff. Additionally, we explained that in fact the day before a different member of staff came to our room to check the mini-bar and found that we had consumed nothing. We suggested that the room be checked as well as the stock, this would confirm nothing had been taken. Eventually, the lady at check out agreed and said they would not charge us any money, we requested a receipt from the hotel showing that no money would be taken and that we owed them nothing. The hotel provided us with the receipt which we currently have in our possession. We recently returned from our trip to San Francisco to discover that in fact the hotel had charged my girlfriend's debit card with the $70 without her consent. We had provided the card at check in which the hotel pre-authorised, as indeed is commonplace at most hotel chains. We had not signed any bill or receipt to confirm it was ok for them to take the money, which indeed we didn't owe them in the first place. Basically, this is at best a very poor mistake, at worst, outright theft and indeed fraud. We have e-mailed the hotel and have yet to receive a reply. My girlfriend has reported the transaction to her bank as fraudulent and we will be helping the bank with their enquiries by providing the receipt from the hotel showing there was no money owed on our account at the time of checking out. This shocking behaviour from the hotel has left us with a sour taste in the mouth after what was a fantastic trip. We're all for paying our own way, however a hotel charging a card without authorisation from the card holder is deplorable - especially as we had not consumed anything from the mini bar. The check out staff at Intercontinental should be aiming a lot higher to uphold the reputation of the hotel itself and the wider brand. If this was the action of one rogue member of staff then appropriate action should be taken. If this is broadly the policy of Intercontinental hotels, I seriously suggest that you don't stay at any of their properties.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Club Lounge!”
Reviews.Author: danielle F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my husband. This is a very nice hotel, great position within city, The staff was very nice and very accommodating. We didn't eat at the hotel, but we did have a couple of drinks at the bar. The Club Lounge is great! You can got there for some apps and drinks before you go out, breakfast and afternoon soup. Every hotel should have this option. Parking is very expensive ($50 a night!!), so we parked across the street.

Reviews.Title: “the good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Bill K
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Intercontinental in Dec 2011. Overall a decent stay but probably would not stay here again. The Good: - clean high end building with nice furniture. modern and elegant. - generally friendly staff. The Bad: - location is not great. its only 2 blocks away from the Powell street BART but those 2 blocks are not the greatest. Definitely wouldn't walk further down the street as there are street people and shady looking characters. would prefer to stay closer to union square next time. The Ugly: The hotel seems to nickel and dime you at every corner. - No complimentary wi-fi- maybe i'm being a bit harsh here but come on! this is a basic amenity in most hotels and should be standard. - Parking is available but only valet at roughly $60 for 24 hours. There is a parkade next door which offers parking for $32 for 24 hours. overall, we had a good stay but the next time we visit San Fran, we will not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It was good hotel, a bit of walk to union square but good enough, good service at concierge, bad: wifi not free, towels r old, h”
Reviews.Author: ECO_minnie
Reviews.Content: It was good hotel, a bit of walk to union square but good enough, good service at concierge, bad: wifi not free $15, towels r old, had humid smell in the room, they need to change , but too tired to change the room

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: deniseacole
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides you with a breathtaking 360 view of San Francisco. The location is great too, close to the Financial District, Market Street, and the Moscone Center. However, if your idea of enjoying San Francisco is by spending more time in places such as North Beach, the Embarcadero, Van Ness, Lombard Street, then I suggest that a car must be used to visit such attractions. The room was impeccably clean and modern. Service was excellent and the staff were really friendly and helpful to the guests. I arrived and checked in at midnight and I was still greeted by friendly, smiling faces.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new, good location and can be reasonable”
Reviews.Author: cuss
Reviews.Content: stayed at the intercontinental 12/29-12/31/11. we got a reasonable flight+hotel package via hot-wire (about $650 for 2 from san diego). although it's a couple blocks south of market, the hotel is very close to the powell street bart and is close walking distance to union square, civic center and surrounding areas. it's a lower traffic area, so it's generally quiet, and there are quite a few nice, low key restaurants around. all the staff were very pleasant (helpful concierge, desk allowed VERY early check-in) and the room was great... comfortable bed, nice fairly large bathroom, big window... free use of pool and gym as well, if you're so inclined (i'm not - i'm on vacation, right?). there are rules here, though... don't open or move anything in the mini bar, unless you're willing to pay for it and if you want to use it as a fridge, you'll pay $30 to deactivate the pay-to-look thing. read the instructions, do or don't pay, but don't complain about it. we put ice in the sink as a beer fridge. why not? the on premise michelin star restaurant luce is too pricey for me, but i hear it's good. OVERALL, I HAVE NOT A SINGLE COMPLAINT. STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful views of the city”
Reviews.Author: krutec
Reviews.Content: had a corner suit with huge windows and great views. Wonderful restaurant with great breakfast buffet. Staff was great. The bellmen were the best I have ever dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “"Service Like No Other!"”
Reviews.Author: marnie1512
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the city for a weekend getaway to see a theater performance as well as have lunch at Neiman Marcus. I had originally planned on booking at the Four Seasons,however, I wanted to try out the newest hotel. To my surprise the service I received by every staff member I encountered was excellent! The staff came across genuinely grateful that I was patronizing their hotel and I felt it! Intercontinental, you will be my only hotel consideration for my frequent San Francisco getaways! I had a high level executive corner room that was exceptionally clean with a fantastic view of the city lit up at night. I'm sold on you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: TimBudi
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying at this hotel and i am satisfied with their quality of service and the room itself. We stayed there for christmas eve, upon checked in they upgrade my standard room to a superior room. The front desk was polite and very accommodating. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was really nice with a huge counter space and big sink. No bath tub but that is ok. Fitness center was nice and well equipped. Swimming pool has a nice length but narrow. Jacuzzi was nice and probably fit for 4-6 people. Location was great, near the Mosconi Center and is just a short walk from the market street. Checking out was a breeze and again very polite front desk staff. I would recommend this hotel. Thank you to all the staff member for making our stay during Christmas memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MrSharma
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Excellent, modern rooms - WiFi was included in our room rate - Hotel car for 2 miles (need to book in advance though) - Walking distance from Market St. - Very near Moscone centre Cons: - Costly - In a somewhat secluded area, i.e. not very close to high-traffic areas - There's a $6 charge to receive a package

Reviews.Title: “Unpolite staff, except for Al”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: Part of the staff corrects you if you say something wrong in english. It's awful. Noises of doors during all night. Dangerous distric. Concierge is not as good as others reviews mentioned. Bell and door man are very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great concierge service”
Reviews.Author: chestunt
Reviews.Content: Concierge was excellent. Iron in room had rusty water in it, husbands shirt was ruined. Called down and the concierge replaced the dress shirt in less than 1/2 hour, they also called restaurant to change our dinner reservation time. Wonderful and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: javl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Intercontinental. The room was beautiful, large, and immaculate. The bathroom was luxurious. There was plenty of room for a cot for our son--a cot which they brought up right away and for which they did not charge (a nice change from the hotels that nickel and dime you). The place was very quiet--our sleep was never disturbed. The people at the concierge desk were always cheerful and helpful. It was very close to the convention center, which was convenient. This was a combination business/convention and a family trip. We had a couple decent meals in the bar, when we were too exhausted to go out or when it was pouring rain. Drinks cost far too much, but I guess that is true of any hotel bar in San Francisco. We tried saving money by going out into the neighborhood for breakfast but, except for Mel's Diner, the other places were quite expensive. On the last day we got the continental breakfast at the hotel for $18, and it wound up being not only delicious but cheaper than most other places, in part because they did not charge for our son's breakfast, which was very nice. My only complaint is that they charge for wi-fi. For a brand new, state of the art hotel, especially one that already charges so much, wi-fi should not be extra. My one recommendation is that they provide an option of allergy-free shampoos and soaps. They had very high-end toiletries--but these aren't good for people with tree nut allergies. I have stayed at 4 InterContinentals over the years, and I have always had a very positive experience. The decor is always sleek, the rooms clean and luxurious, and the staff very professional and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, property, value...but hit or miss check-in times”
Reviews.Author: johndhenry
Reviews.Content: Superb location - short walk to Biz district, Mkt. & Union St. shopping, Museums, BART, Conv. Ctr. Large bright rooms for SF (Tip: request an upper floor for better views). But, every time I stay my reserved room is never ready - event after 4pm (this time I didn't get a room until 5pm). 2 adults + 2 tweens stayed in room with 2 large dbl. beds. The hotel common areas and rooms are spotlessly clean, bright, and very big. Also, this has to be the lowest priced upper-end hotel in the city...so I will continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy room and good location”
Reviews.Author: SirGoofy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business trip for a few days. Very convenient location as you can take the BART to get to the hotel from SFO. Overall the room is clean and I find it quite cosy too. Wish the wifi is free in the room but the paid connection is very good. Would definitely consider staying here again if visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Britontherails
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by this hotel. The rooms were great - big and clean, and really up-to-date. I had a great view of the bay and it was just a great place to be on a business trip. The only downsides for me were as follows: Not many restaurants near the hotel. Hotel restaurant itself is rubbish (took ages to bring food, very up itself with no cause to be... mediocre food and boring atmosphere). The hotel were having trouble with their wifi on some floors. I arrived, a single business traveller, with suitcase and laptop bag. I checked into my room, unpacked, and then tried to get online. I had to completely repack as I had to move to a room which had internet. This was really, really annoying and it's not as if they couldn't have noticed that I'd need the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Gold star in customer service”
Reviews.Author: Kehau R
Reviews.Content: Don't let the location turn you off . . . I hosted a small event at the hotel and while my colleague who does our events worked with them on the day-to-day details, I can say that the event went off without a hitch. We didn't have issues with the dedicated Internet connection (which we've had in the past with other hotels) and the food that they served was so yummy. They also were so quick to turn around requests. The hotel lobby and bar are beautiful and the rooms themselves are pretty standard. What I really liked about the hotel is the staff, which is probably one of the friendliest I have ever encountered. All were extremely nice and helpful and in the end, that is why I'm giving the hotel a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Best concierge service I've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Ntryoko
Reviews.Content: The concierge service here was outstanding and I've stayed in many Intercons and they generally do concierge well. Nothing was too much trouble from finger nail repairs to fine local dining. Wil definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Steffenino
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Lovely new rooms with everything you could possibly need. The beds were heaven!
