However, the Westin is a fine hotel, and most people will probably find its location to be just a bit better. I've stayed in a number of San Francisco's better hotels and can recommend most, but either of these, if obtained at a reasonable price, will definitely please most travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Choice for Downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: BlueRTA
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Intercontinental San Francisco. What a great choice! For the rate we paid, the room was outstanding. It was obvious that the hotel was new and the big screen LCD TV was excellent. The location was nice, a few blocks walk to Union Square and/or the trolley/BART. One block to the Westfield Shopping Center. By comparison, the neighborhood just to the south and west did not look too inviting but it was safe enough during the day. Definitely avoid using a rental car if possible, the parking fees are high at the hotel and driving in SF is not a good idea. It was very easy to get to all of our tours on foot from the hotel; we walked to most of them (be sure to bring your jacket). We had a great view of the city from the 26th floor, corner room. Service was overall very good and the room was properly cleaned. The hotel restaurant (Luce) had some very good fusion-style food choices; the bar was OK for hanging out in but a bit loud due to its lobby location. Overall I would not hesitate to recommend the Intercontinental for a vacation or business destination.

Reviews.Title: “I love new hotels - this one is very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: European_Traveller99
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel before it opened through their website because we wanted to have the luxury of something new for a unique visit to San Francisco. And I wanted to make the one and only visit to San Francisco for my wife as memorable as possible. The tower is amazing, the entrance is a bit of a tiny experience for this kind of place - so was the welcome. Some of the receptionists are not really friendly and do not give you the feeling of being welcome for the money spent and that your special requests matter in any way to the powerful staff. Priority of the welcome interview was given to get the rates of the pre-paid (!) rooms initialed, advise us of the smoking penalties after we booked a non-smoking room (!) and emphasize that no room change is possible without major compromises on our side (after posting special requests 6 months before !). This is the opposite of priority treatment. Unacceptable for this kind of place where even a short stay may cost a decent amount of money. I have experienced exceptional welcomes in Asia and other places in the US so I kow what may be expected. Coming to the room (we paid for an extra category to be in floors 25...30) we really liked the luxury bathroom, noble desk area and super-comfortable beds without the lightest smell from previous guests. Absolutely clean and perfect. Just new... Even if the room was a little small from what we are used to from other luxury hotels we basically got what we expected as far as the room comfort was concerned. The view out of the windows howewer disappointed us greatly. We overlooked the bay area South of Market Street with the incoming freeway. Not the amazing view we booked a high floor for. I just noticed that I did not even take a photo of this ugly view among the 800 pics I took in SF. And the rude lady at the reception told us that there is no possibility to get a more interesting city view that we requested with our booking almost 6 months ago. Good "management" of our special request - or was it lack of ....whatever ? Anyway - due to the behaviour of the personnel for check-in we decided not to have any meals in the hotel and enjoy the wide variety of choices in the nearby heart of the city. A good decision in San Francisco, and very cost-effective also. Anyway, the hotel was quite a good coice, not an exceptional one. The city is of course - exceptional !

Reviews.Title: “Instant Service???”
Reviews.Author: 5starsmyeye
Reviews.Content: I was at the same convention as ProactiveHonolulu and suffered a similar fate. It really felt as if the hotel is either understaffed and unable to handle convention business (which begs the question of why build right next to a busy convention center) or felt that the delegates to this particular convention were not the sort of clientele they wish to see at the hotel. I arrived and due to some miscommunication, not the fault of the hotel, my reservation had not been made. It took the front desk staff and numerous managers nearly 2 hours to "find" a room for me--I was repeatedly told they were overbooked but somehow a room did exist. The room was very nice and comfortable, although rather small, but for some reason it wasn't serviced 1 out of the 7 days I stayed there. Additionally, the hotel nickel and dimes you for everything: $30 for a rollaway bed, $15 for internet access, etc. They even tried to charge a fellow traveler for moving (not consuming) items in the minibar! The biggest joke is the "Instant Service" button on the phones. It takes them at least 10 rings to answer and then the service is far from "instant." It took nearly 2 hours to get a rollaway bed and when I called twice to have it picked up, it never was. They tried to charge for the extra day even though I had called for its removal but at least removed the charge when I complained. The hotel is new, clean, and upscale but the management is suspect. This is rampant in today's hotel market so I guess I shouldn't expect better. The big corporations who own these hotels answer to shareholders not customers so if you strip the staff (especially middle management) to the bone and report a profit for the last quarter that's all that matters. Sad.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental good for price”
Reviews.Author: seasuzie
Reviews.Content: We were promised a room with 2 queen beds which to make a long story short never happened. After waiting a couple of hours for our room to be ready we were disappointed they gave us a room with two double beds. I had explained to reservation office when making my initial reservation that we were two adults and two kids and needed two queen beds. They assured me we would have them. It never happened which really disappointed me because I picked this hotel because they promised two queen beds!! Besides that, the room was clean, my kids enjoyed the pool and the fellow travelers were very nice and polite. The staff basically lied to us which I do not appreciate. I told my husband wow, people lie here and don't even feel bad! (We were also lied to when we rented bikes with our kids that the ride was easy and piece of cake across the Golden Gate Bridge, which it wasn't but worth it!!)

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service for Up-Scale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ProactiveHonolulu
Reviews.Content: The hotel was selected due to the proximity of a convention I attended at the Mascone Convention Center. The staff at the front desk treated guests like robots. Not a very warm reception upon check-in by the staff. Management was rather rude to another fellow union member who wanted to bring in food and drinks for personal consumption. This is an up-scale, luxury property and not where college frats would stay and have wild parties, but that's how the fellow union member was treated. The elevators where constantly out of service while filled at capacity due to the convention. The best service of the whole stay was from the bell-man. He was the most hospitable of all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at the beautiful Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: towniemel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to San Fran with two friends and stayed at the new Intercontinental on Howard next to Moscone Convention Center. I loved this place. The room was gorgeous, with very comfortable beds, great views via the floor to ceiling windows, and a great, huge, walk-in, glass-door shower. The best thing about this hotel is the service. Their concierge desk helped us with maps, directions, info re: shipping packages, mailing postcards and virtually anything we needed. The staff were so very friendly and helpful. The doormen let us park our rental car for free just by the door while we packed and checked out. Definitely above board service for the price we paid. The lobby and bar are lovely, though we never really used it. The lap pool is very sleek and serene and relaxing, and there is a great terrace. We were on the 18th floor. The price goes up the higher you are. If you can swing it, I would highly recommend going as high up as possible on the western side of the hotel. We faced east, and while the view was sweeping (I spent a lot of time looking out and then at my map trying to figure out what everything was) I did go up to the highest floor I could reach without a room key and even saw the Golden Gate on a very clear day facing west. If you do not mind being a long hilly walk from Fisherman's Wharf but near great shopping, the Embarcadero and Ferry Building, fairly close to Chinatown and the Polk St. Station for the cable cars, then I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: MachThree
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, brand new hotel. First I'll go through the good stuff. Everything here is brand new and beautiful - the lobby rivals the W's a few blocks away with a beautiful bar, restaraunt, and reception area, the carpeting in the halls and all the common areas are (gasp!) clean and actually nice! Our room was gorgeous - we had a corner room on the 30th floor - floor to ceiling windows afforded us a terrific view of the city's skyline to the north and the bay to the east. The bathroom was gorgeous, with ceramic tile, a digital scale, and (what seems to be a rarety for hotels) towels that were actually large enough. The room was also equipped with a very large LCD HDTV, and the bed was exceedingly comfortable. The staff was also exceedingly friendly, helpful, and courteous. Other ammentities included an indoor lap pool, jacuzzi, and a full service spa, and the best gym I've ever seen in a hotel. As you'd expect from an Intercontinental, it truly feels like an upscale hotel and a special experience. Can only say two negative things about our whole experience there. a) the parking fee is outlandish - $46 / night. b) The location may not be the best, depending on why you are visiting San Francisco. Basically, the hotel is situated at the southeast corner of what seems to be a nice area - immediately to the north and to the west are the Mascone Center (San Francisco's convention center), two malls, and a block or two further north is San Francisco's Museum of Modern Art. So if you want to visit the museum or you are attending a convention, the location is great. If you are like me, however, and like to explore on foot, most of the other main attractions are a pretty long ways away. Unfortunately, nothing to the south or the east looked too savory, I wouldn't really want to walk in that direction from the hotel. When I go back to San Francisco, I am definetly going to try and book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abenitaj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to everything. There is a mall approximately one block behind the hotel. Everything else is within walking distance, ie. cable cars, F train, shopping etc. The room was a wee bit small but exceptionally clean. The floor to ceiling windows provided for wonderful views. The bathroom was very modern and spacious. The beds were very comfortable. The maids ring the door bell to the room before entering. Check in and out was a breeze. The pictures from previous viewers of the hotel and rooms are exact. If you want great suggestions for resturants, ask for Earnest at the porter's station. He suggested, Sears Fine foods which was about a 1 mile walk towards Union Square. Great food. He also suggested an Italian Resturant down by the Fisherman's Wharf that's spelled something like Chiccolic. Wonderful, Wonderful food. Take either the trolley/cable car or the F train to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. If you are looking for tours, I suggest the San Francisco City tour and the brunch cruise by Viocor only. I would stay here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lukewarm to Intercontinental SF”
Reviews.Author: Jim51519
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, clean and first class. We had 2 rooms both of similar (reasonable) size. One had a shower & no tub, the other a tub shower. Great plasma TV. My only complaint (as with most expensive hotels) is that most things are an extra charge. Want to use the mini bar fridge? $30 charge to empty it (if you move a bottle in the mini bar it is electronically sensed and you get charged). Parking....$45 per night. Internet is an extra charge. Overall the hotel is lovely, & comfortable. You need to consider whether the downtown location works for you. There are few moderate family restaurants very nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Infiniti
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 6 nights on a vacation. We had booked two rooms, and the staff very kindly put us in rooms only two doors away. One of them was a corner room, and while it would normaly cost a lot more, the staff let us pay the standard room price. (Which we had booked.) Both rooms were spotlessly clean and had modern furnishings and amenities, and housekeeping did a good job for the most part. All rooms have high-def plasma TV's and i-Pod docking stations. All staff members were extremly profesional. I don't know why everyone complains about the location. Upon check in the desk clerk pulled out a map, clearly marked where not to go, and gave it to us. Pretty simple really. A short walk up Howard towards 4th gets you right in the middle of everything. During our stay we just had two minor problems. One time the maid replaced a shampoo bottle with body wash, and the floor to ceiling windows were rather dirty, not that there's much of a view anyway. This might not qaulify as a problem but the breakfast was extremely expensive, $25 a person expensive! If you want a really nice breakfast, I suggest going to one of the many Starbucks in the area, buy a few pastries, and go eat them in Union Square. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Don't head one street in the wrong direction”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: It looks new and clean and carrys the Intercontinental brand so we thougth we were safe. In 3 days we witnessed a mugging 30 feet from the front door, the next street across Sixth street is home of XXX rated cinemas and a high population of homeless people with untreated mental heath issues. The hotel charges extras for everything - parking $46 +tax per night,wifi at $15 per night, a roll away bed $30 per night, when you are already paying full price for a room for 2 chilren under 12! The staff haven't yet adopted the 'can do ' attitude for guests, together with its rough location means this will not be a repeat experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hafgrape
Reviews.Content: Great hotel very sleek and modern in an ideal location for visiting the sites and for shopping. The room was well decorated, minimal, spacious, with a huge bed, big bathroom, coffee maker (but strangely no milk/cream or sugar), robes etc. Facilities - great pool which is actually a swimming pool not a paddling pool so you could do laps. great jacuzzi. The gym looked well equipped but we didn't try it (it was our holiday!). The outdoor terrace was great to sit out on when it was warm enough. Food - sorry can't comment as we didn't try the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Ziggy02
Reviews.Content: Got a wonderful rate of $129 for a standard room. Can't complain at all about the rate. The hotel is modern and tastefully decorated. I got good value for what I paid. However, that said, the "standard room" did not meet my expectations of an Intercontinental Hotel. Apart from the flat screen TV and a nice large shower, it seemed more like a Mariott. The room was small and noisy, and had a view of an abandoned parking lot. Tip for other travelers -- if you don't want to hear sirens and traffic all night long, avoid rooms 03 & 04, which face onto 5th street. Service was okay. Nothing to complain about but nothing to rave about either.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service - EVER”
Reviews.Author: IrishWeather
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights recently for a conference. It has quite simply, the rudest, most ignorant, unhelpful staff of any hotel I have ever stayed in. But let me go into detail..... I checked in at midday and was told my room was not ready. This was fine as, in fairness, i was early. I provided my credit card and passport details and was told by the reception person that I could leave my bag with the porters and pick up my key at any time after 3pm. I actually ended up returning to the hotel at 10pm, at which time there was a huge queue at reception. I asked the porter if he could get the key from reception for me but was told... in no uncertain terms... that he couldn't help. Now, having queued once that day, I wasn't about to do it again... so I stood to one side at the main desk and got one of the reception staffs attention while she was between guests. When I told her i was picking up a key she said "You'll have to join the line." When I explained the situation she turned away, dealt with another customer and then asked me my name, which she eventually looked up in the system. She then told me that I hadn't in fact checked in and so would have "to join the line." Now, I was getting a bit peeved at this point and told here there was no way I was joining the line. So... she ignored me... and ignored me... and ignored me... for at least ten minutes. I then asked to speak to her manager... and was ignored. So a few minutes later when it was clear that she wasn't getting the manager I asked again... so she left her post and went to the other end of the desk where her manager was also dealing with people. Great I thought.... the manager will be along now and we can get this sorted! How wrong I was! The manager also completely ignored me and left me standing there like a lemon! Eventually, and this is after a good half hour of waiting... I actually did join the line. I honestly couldn't believe it... they made a mistake checking me in (i still wonder just what did they do with my details the first time around) and I had to pay for it with my time. Unbelieveable. So, none too happy I asked to see a manager the next day. The only manager available was the head of security who came out "Maffia style" (i.e. flanked by a blank faced goon with an ear piece). In fairness to him, he listened to the issue and grudgingly apologised but didn't offer any remedial gesture what so ever. He also never explained why he felt it necessary to have his own personal security guard with him while listening to my complaint. This hotel is new and it shows. The staff are completely clueless as to how guests are normally treated in a hotel of this standard. As for the hotel and facilities... the public spaces are minimalist.... i.e. all the charm of an airport lounge. The rooms are nice but there are no baths which I know quite a few people didnt like. Ive stayed in top class hotels all over the world. This wasn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: “great service, great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ajd1307
Reviews.Content: excellent service (both front desk and bar/restaurant), nice decor, comfortable bed, nice view from the room, highly recommend it if you want to be on that side of san francisco--ideal for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: vanillagice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I styed at the Intercontinental on what may have been the hottest Friday of the season for San Francisco (6/20). The hotel staff is friendly, but no more so than any other upscale hotel in the city. The hotel is located across the street from the Museum of Modern Art, yet no mention was made of the Frida Kahlo show going on there. It wasn't until we were leaving the city that I realized the show was even there. I would expect more from a hotel that (normally) charges so much and is RIGHT ACROSS from the museum. I got a screamin' deal from Hotwire though, and would stay there again if I were able to get another such deal ($129/night).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel, with small hotel service”
Reviews.Author: RachLondon
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the new Intercontinental in May this year. We got a great rate as it had just opened. Generally I'm not keen on big impersonal hotels as I find that often you are treated as one of three hundred guests rather than getting great service - but I was thoroughly impressed by this hotel. The service was friendly and helpful, breakfasts fantastic and the rooms were gorgeous, with an amazing view whichever side you're on (try and get a high up room). We didn't have a bath in our room, but we didn't ask for one and I feel sure if requested you'd get one. But the bathroom was gorgeous with a massive walk-in shower. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the main shopping area, where the tram exchange is and about a 10-15 walk to union square - but we found the location great. It's hard to find a criticism, but if I had to I'd say the doormen seemed to be invisible - but hey I can open a door myself!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: macsym
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my 3 night stay here. Staff were generally friendly and pro-active. I actually thought the location was good. It was very convenient for all the transport options in Market Street, the Powell Street cable car and shopping in the Westfield Centre and Union Square. However, the corner of Howard and 4th can be very windy! I stayed on the 33rd floor and had good views of the Bay and AT&T stadium. The room was relaxing and comfortable and the bathroom was particularly good and the generous toiletries excellent. Housekeeping was very good. In a brand new hotel I might have expected international sockets at the desk rather than just 3 US ones. The Club Lounge on the 6th floor was pleasant and offered a good breakfast and nice range of drinks in the evenings. Club Reception staff were friendly and welcoming although those serving lacked the expected degree of professionalism. A 2pm check out is offered to club guests but this was readily extended to 4pm and guests are able to make use of the club facilities until they actually leave the hotel which is generous and useful if one has a late flight. The best staff I encountered were at the concierge desk – very friendly and helpful. The only disappointment was my actual arrival and departure – no assistance with luggage, no escort to the room, no enquiry as to the enjoyability of my stay. The hotel is business (especially conference delegates) orientated but that need not be a deterrent for tourists. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Club”
Reviews.Author: VfB 1893
Reviews.Content: Our stay: We stayed for nine nights and due to our Ambassador status we received a great upgrade to the club floor which is located on the 6th floor. Room: Our room was on the 31st floor (all club rooms are on the 31st and 32nd floor), and had a great view over the SF Bay. The room itself was not too large, but impeccably clean and new. The furnishing is very modern and bright. The bathroom was spacious and although the water pressure was a little low there was nothing to complain! Room Service: Adapting to SF styles we went for light foods, the best food we found was the bean soup. A little awkward is that the hotel charges the tip automatically, then 3$ for delivery, plus tax... we are not used to this coming from Europe. Pricing in general for f&b is high, but a good Euro to USD rate helped us ignore the pricing a little... Air Conditioning / Bed: The airconditioning worked perfectly. You can change between Fahrenheit and Celsius, and the temperature can be regulated by .5 degrees. The bed was the best I slept in so far-and I travel a lot, and stay at top brands. But this bed beat everything, just like the linen! Perfect! The Club Level: It was very nice of the management to upgrade us to the club, as you enjoy breakfast and snacks during certain hours. Complimentary drinks are available all time. The only criticism we would have is that the service (f&b) at the club is terribly aloof, and often is overwhelmed by their duty. Often plates piled up, cutlery was not exchanged (like at Hyatt), and often you had to ask for things which were then brought quickly though. All in all, if you stick around the city during the day, I would go for it again! In general the IC SF is a more business oriented hotel, but we meet other honeymooners, and casual guests. It did not disturb us, but if you are looking for a hotel with a typical californian atmosphere you would better look for another type of hotel. All in all our advise is, pay a little more for the room, and enjoy great views. The district is a bit run down but improving. In case you are looking for parking possibilities, there is a large parking garage a street away, max. 30 USD for 24h - we recommend this option more than the hotels valet parking 45USD.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a WONDERFUL place...service could have been a tad...”
Reviews.Author: ScrappyGal
Reviews.Content: better. The hotel is gorgeous and seeing that it opened late February, the place is still wonderfully new. The rooms are nice and the views amazing. Very, very chic. I went with a couple of my friends and we requested a room with 2 queens, but they were out of those rooms the first night. After numerous calls on my part, the staff kept on asking me to call them back because they weren't sure what rooms would be available after cleaning. (Which I think was sort of a fib to try to discourage me.) Anyhow, we stuck with our room, although a bit cramped, the newness and cleanliness of it made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and service!”
Reviews.Author: glendaculbertson
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the hotel if you want great amenities and service. The bay view from the 30th floor was amazing. The room was just like being at home: soothing colors, a super-comfortable king size bed, newspaper service in the morning, an iPod docking station, a shower with strong water pressure and room for two :D and toiletries that were worth taking home! The gym was big, and each treadmill had individual TVs! My home gym doesn't have this! The pool was just like an infinity pool and perfect for swimming laps. The spa was secluded from the entrance and it had a perfect view of the large LCD TV in the gym. Whoever planned that knew exactly what people want from a hot tub experience! The hotel is just as important to me as the sights in the city. Mark my words, this is the only hotel I will stay in when visiting the City!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience for the Price”
Reviews.Author: tehsuck
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here when I was at a conference in late May, 2008. The first thing I noticed about this hotel is that it's absolutely gorgeous. Everything is absolutely pristine and new. One thing that blew me away about this hotel was the level of service. Every staff member was above and beyond curtious and helpful. Every time I left or came in there someone would greet me, and/or open the door for me. Security was also impressive. I accidentally left my door open a crack when I came back at one point and about 5 minute later there were two employees knocking on my door to make sure everything was ok. I ordered room service a few times and the food was a decent quality. I'd have to say it's a bit overpriced. I was a bit disappointed that I had to pay for wifi.

HotelInfo.Name: InterContinental San Francisco
HotelInfo.Address: 888 Howard Street, San Francisco, CA 94103
